post: Every $1 helps an educator share the Constitution with a student. Together, weve helped thousands of students nationwide discover their rights and responsibilities. How will you champion civics this month? ➡️  https://bit.ly/40EsBAg  #CivicEducation  #CivicsChampion  #EducationMatters  #Philanthropy  #Constitution

How can middle school students understand both the progress and resistance that shaped Reconstruction? In this new Civics and U. S. History for Middle School video, explore how art reveals the struggles to rebuild a nation and secure equal rights after the Civil War. 🎥  https://bit.ly/4p97kZ8  #CivicEducation  #TeachingHistory  #Reconstruction  #MiddleSchool  #CivicLearning

🎉 Honoring Educators Who Bring the Declaration to Life Were thrilled to announce the first 63 winners of the Civic Star Challenge, a nationwide initiative from the Bill of Rights Institute and iCivics that empowers K–12 teachers to celebrate Americas founding principles in the classroom. These educators, representing more than 25 states, are inspiring the next generation to see liberty, equality, and civic virtue not just as history, but as living ideals. Each winner receives $300 in recognition of their commitment to bringing the Declaration of Independence to life through adaptable, classroom-ready lessons. As BRI President David Bobb shared, The Civic Star Challenge honors the educators who keep Americas founding principles alive in their classrooms. Their work reminds us that civic knowledge and virtue are essential to sustaining liberty for the next generation.  Congratulations to this first round of winners, and thank you to every teacher who continues to make civic learning a daily act of service. 🌟 🔗 Read the full announcement:  https://bit.ly/3LvYuX0  #CivicStarChallenge  #CivicEducation  #America250  #Teachers  #CivicLearning  #EducationLeadership

Cycle 1 winners are in, now its your turn. Start fresh with the Civic Star Challenge: log 1 quick, A250-aligned activity and your class is entered for this months drawings (300+ chances this year). 🔗  https://bit.ly/3V1CQuX  #CivicStarChallenge  #CivicEducation  #America250  #TeachingResources  #K12

This Veterans Day week, we remember Lt. Michael P. Murphy, a Navy SEAL whose courage during Operation Red Wings defined duty, sacrifice, and leadership. Listen to his powerful story on the Our American Stories with Lee Habeeb podcast ⬇️ 🎧  https://ihr.fm/4nNMbCR  #HonoringService  #VeteransDay  #Leadership  #CivicVirtues  #CivicEducation

Were proud to support teachers across North Dakota through workshops that bring civic education to life. From virtual sessions to hands-on lessons in Bismarck, educators explored how BRIs resources align with state standards and foster civil discourse in classrooms. Read more about our work with North Dakota teachers ⬇️ 🔗  https://bit.ly/3LzDWNc  #CivicEducation  #Teaching  #ProfessionalDevelopment  #BillofRightsInstitute

How did Thomas Jefferson and James Madison respond to the Alien and Sedition Acts of 1798? In this new Primary Source Essentials episode, explore how their Kentucky and Virginia Resolutions shaped early debates over free speech, states rights, and federal power. 🎥  https://bit.ly/48b5st5  #CivicEducation  #AmericanHistory  #Federalism  #PrimarySources  #TeachingHistory

No project is too small to make a difference. From a single clean-up to launching a nonprofit, every MyImpact Challenge story shows what civic virtue looks like in action. Do you know a student who is making an impact? 🌟 Share MyImpact Challenge with them:  https://bit.ly/3fyGGr3  #MyImpactChallenge  #CivicLeadership  #ServiceLearning  #CommunityImpact

This Veterans Day, BRI's Gerald Gangaram, MAJ, U. S. Army (Ret.), reflects on how military service shaped his view of leadership, civic duty, and unity, and why civic education keeps those values alive.  #HonoringService  #Leadership  #CivicVirtue  #VeteransDay  #CivicEducation

This Veterans Day, we honor those who have served in uniform, and continue to serve their communities. Gerald Gangaram speaks with Darin Pemberton of RangeWalk about leadership, courage, and civic virtue in and beyond the Army. Thank you to our sponsor, CaptionCall by Sorenson, which provides no-cost captioned telephones for veterans and service members with hearing loss. 🎥 Watch:  https://bit.ly/4hU9HMX  #VeteransDay  #HonoringService  #CivicVirtue  #Leadership  #CivicEducation
